plot: Dave Lizewski is an unnoticed high school student and comic book fan with a few friends and who lives alone with his father. His life is not very difficult and his personal trials not that overwhelming. However, one day he makes the simple decision to become a super-hero even though he has no powers or training.

m.role: Crusading Widower: Big Daddy. Not a big secret to those who read the comics, but the reasons are different.
Dogged Nice Guy: Dave is this trope personified.
Overlord Jr.: Chris D'Amico/Red Mist at the end.
Papa Wolf: Inverted when Hit-Girl goes on a Roaring Rampage of Revenge to save her dad. Unfortunately, she is too late.
Scary Black Man: Rasul's and Frank's bodyguards are huge black guys with an unfriendly attitude  and a bazooka in the latter case.

f.role: Red Mist also serves as a counterpart to Hit-Girl, in that both of them have parents that are involved in very dangerous work. But while Hit-Girl actually has her father's love and approval, Red Mist is a ''Well Done, Son!'' Guy who spends the whole movie trying to impress his father, who ironically enough already tries to spend time with him doing normal things.
Girlish Pigtails: Mindy tends to wear them when out of her Hit-Girl costume.
Hit-Girl has achieved some level of this in Real Life. For values of 'real life' that include Internet forums.

Mafia Prince and Queen: Chris/Red Mist and Mrs. D'Amico. Chris is aware that his father's a crimelord, apparently, and wants to be just like him but spends most of the movie without realizing just how terrible his father's deeds really are. Mrs. D'Amico gets too little screentime to tell if she knows or cares about her husband's exploits.

Missing Mom: Dave's mother died of an aneurysm at breakfast one morning; his father has, as far as we see, never really adjusted. Mindy's mother, meanwhile, committed suicide via pills from depression following her husband's arrest... while pregnant. It's a wonder why neither of them have a moral distinction in their behavior.

Small Girl, Big Gun: Averted by Hit-Girl. Although she has her father's extensive arsenal at her disposal, her weapons of choice are pistols like the SIG Sauer P232 and H&K USP Compact that fit her small hands. Realistically, any larger firearm would be very difficult for someone of her size to operate well.
Tomboy: Hit-Girl's favourite toys are knives and guns, and she has quite a potty mouth. Sometimes, she pretends to be a "girly girl" to prank her father.

name: Kick-Ass
